image.altText: A man in a hat and flannelette shirt on a khaki-coloured all-terrain vehicle.

props.synopsis: Neighbouring landholders of a private hydro-electric scheme in north-west Tasmania fear what will happen if it begins pumping again, after it was paused last year to investigate potential flooding.

title.children: Farmer buys amphibious, eight-wheeled vehicle after he says nearby hydro scheme flooded his property

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars of Australian $50 notes showing Edith Cowan

props.synopsis: Tasmanian politicians could be required to disclose any donation that exceeds $1,000 after opposition parties banded together to force a Greens bill through the lower house.

title.children: Tasmania's minority parliament overrules government, backs $1,000 political donation disclosure limit

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: A Virgin flight was forced to make an abrupt U-turn over Bass Strait less than half an hour from its destination after missing a runway curfew due to planned upgrade works.

title.children: Virgin flight does U-turn over Bass Strait after missing Hobart airport curfew

image.altText: Hands clasping at prison cell bars, good generic for prison, detention, jail, confinement

props.synopsis: If millions of taxpayers' dollars, wrecked lives and "harrowing" stories of abuse aren't enough to speed up the closure of Tasmania's notorious Ashley youth prison, then what is?

title.children: Tasmania will pay $75m to kids whose lives were ruined at a prison which is still open, despite years of promises to shut it

image.altText: Reid Ludwig died after a stabbing incident

props.synopsis: Since her son's death in a stabbing attack in 2019, Laraine Ludwig has campaigned for tougher knife laws in Tasmania. Now, with a trial for police to be able to search for weapons about to begin, she hopes no other family will go through what her's did.

title.children: Mum of stabbing victim hoping Reid's Law will help to stop Tasmanians carrying concealed knives

image.altText: A man between large rocks in a river holds on to one end of a yellow rope

props.synopsis: A rescue team faced with a terrible decision, complicated by a language barrier and unthinkable challenges, such as 13 tonnes of water per second to deal with. How did they save a man trapped for more than 20 hours in a river?

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 How rescuers freed a man trapped while whitewater rafting

image.altText: Household money pic

props.synopsis: Australia's inflation rate remained steady in October, with rising prices for food, alcohol, cigarettes and recreational activities keeping it at 2.1 per cent annually.

title.children: RBA still unlikely to lower interest rates in 2024 despite inflation at its lowest level in more than three years

image.altText: A man stands at a lectern.

props.synopsis: The ABC's chair Kim Williams calls for more investment in the public broadcaster as a counter to the "flood" of online misinformation and disinformation, days after the federal government's decision to abandon legislation that would have forced social media giants to tackle harmful content on their platforms.

title.children: ABC chair warns Australia 'flooded' with misinformation days after government abandons bill to tackle social media content

image.altText: A hand holding a $10 and $20 note of cash.

props.synopsis: The federal government announced a plan to change the way student debts were indexed months ago. Now the legislation will finally start saving students money.

title.children: HECS changes are finally law. It could mean student debt credits for some — and refunds for others

image.altText: The two teams line up near the logos for the AFLW grand final, the Lions and the Kangaroos as a singer performs.

props.synopsis: AFLW fans who didn't get tickets to the grand final are left disappointed after it sold out within hours for the second year in a row being held at Princes Park with a limited capacity.

title.children: 'Hard for the game to grow': Fans disappointed after being locked out of AFLW grand final at limited capacity venue

image.altText: Two men talking to media.

props.synopsis: The bodies of two Melbourne teenagers who died after suspected methanol poisoning in Laos return home, as Laos police investigating their deaths detain eight men.

title.children: 'We miss our daughters desperately': Families of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles welcome Laos arrests

image.altText: a woman is sitting at a table looking at a utility bill.

props.synopsis: With so many technological advances, why does it feel like we spend more time doing paperwork than ever before? And who is profiting from all the virtual paper shuffling?

title.children: Businesses are now trying to sell everything 'as a service' and you're paying with your time

image.altText: An illustration of a gymnast looking at their phone.

props.synopsis: A gymnastics coach who quit the Australian Olympic team after the ABC revealed he allegedly harassed a former colleague is now being accused of making sexual comments to his former teenage athletes.

title.children: 'He used to name our bums': Melbourne gymnastics coach who withdrew from Paris Olympics facing more allegations

image.altText: Teen girl with curly hair and tan skin looks down at her phone wearing a stripy jumper. There are social media icons next to her

props.synopsis: Yesterday, parliament heard that the major parties will come together and pass a law banning teenagers from social media, after a period of careful thought roughly commensurate with that of a 15-year-old making a Black Friday impulse buy at Shein.com.

title.children: Parliament delivers a performance piece of legislative 'enshittification' that raises more questions than answers

image.altText: a magpie and dog lay on the ground

props.synopsis: Molly the magpie may once again have to be surrendered to wildlife authorities after a Supreme Court order has overturned a government decision to grant a special licence to the bird's carers.

title.children: Couple caring for internet-famous Molly the magpie has licence revoked by court

image.altText: A woman rests her head on another woman's shoulder.

props.synopsis: It was two days before Christmas when Mary Malbiynga's little sister was killed by her partner at Darwin's famous Mindil Beach.

title.children: Screams for 20 minutes and no help. Inside the NT's domestic violence tragedy

props.synopsis: The Chinese national, in Australia illegally, has been sentenced in a Queensland court for using a SIM box to send out millions of fake texts purporting to be from agencies including Centrelink and Australia Post, but claims he was unaware they were part of a phishing scam.

title.children: Scammer who sent five million rogue texts claims he thought he was working in advertising

image.altText: Tyler smiles while holding up a large nugget of gold.

props.synopsis: Tyler Mahoney likes to call herself a "professional gold digger" — but that doesn't mean what you think it means.

title.children: In a world where card payments rule, this 'gold digger' says cash is still king in the outback

image.altText: An extreme close up of Angela Merkel with half of her face bathed in sunlight, with the other in darkness

props.synopsis: During her 16 years in office, former German chancellor Angela Merkel served alongside countless world leaders. In her new memoir, she takes aim at Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump.

title.children: Merkel's new memoir details Putin's power games and Trump's antics

image.altText: A large treebranch on the ground with a van behind it.

props.synopsis: A man has died and his teenage son has been injured after a tree branch struck their car at a Yarrawonga camping ground during wild weather on Tuesday night.

title.children: Falling tree branch kills father, injures teenage son attempting to escape bushy campground during Victorian storm

image.altText: An Indigenous Australian man stands outside a building looking happy.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Aboriginal station workers who had their wages withheld or stolen due to discriminatory government policy will be compensated $16,500 each, the Federal Court rules.

title.children: Aboriginal station workers and their families to share $144 million in stolen wages class action

image.altText: woman and man walking together being affectionate

props.synopsis: While sharing money is a not a prerequisite for a financially healthy relationship, experts say having a joint bank account has its benefits when managed the right way.

title.children: The pros and cons of opening a joint bank account

image.altText: A wide v shaped line that looks bull dozed into a shrubby desert landscape from an aerial view.

props.synopsis: The origin of the strange clearing, which is still visible today, was detected by a scientist trawling through satellite data.

title.children: A tornado tore across the Nullarbor but we're only just learning about it now

image.altText: A young white toddler reads a book with her mother by a kitchen window

props.synopsis: The Inclusion Support Program aims to help early learning centres remove barriers that prevent them from including students with disability. But childcare workers have told the ABC they're having problems accessing the scheme.

title.children: 'Absolutely furious, bewildered, and sad': Families say multi-million-dollar 'inclusion' program is excluding their kids

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek holds a python at Parliament House

props.synopsis: After an intense day on Tuesday of last-minute negotiations and lobbying by environmental and mining groups in which a deal was said to have "come close", the government has now shelved the talks.

title.children: WA premier lobbied Albanese to kill Greens deal on environmental reform in eleventh hour intervention

image.altText: Two women holding hands walk outside of the Adelaide Magistrates Court with a journalist alongside holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman who claimed she was trying to save her husband's life moments before he died has walked free from the Adelaide Magistrates Court after a murder charge against her was dropped.

title.children: Wife who claimed self-defence following husband's death has murder charge dropped

image.altText: A blurred photo of the share trading boards at the Australian stock exchange

props.synopsis: Australia's annual inflation rate remained steady in October at a more than three-year low as electricity and fuel prices fell. The local share market rose after a rally on Wall Street. Follow how the day's trade unfolded on the markets blog.

title.children: ASX rises as inflation rate stays steady, RBNZ cuts interest rates — as it happened

image.altText: A man holding a jack russell terrier in one arm outside a house

props.synopsis: Two fishermen and their Jack Russell terrier were rescued by a local on his surfboard off South Australia's Limestone Coast after they were believed to have spent about seven hours in the water when their boat had sunk.

title.children: Surfer rescues brothers and their 3-legged dog after seven-hour ordeal off South Australian coast

image.altText: A young woman with a plastic bandage over her eye

props.synopsis: Ranem Abu Izneid fears her dreams of becoming a dentist are over after she was hit with shrapnel while studying in her university accommodation in the West Bank.

title.children: Melbourne woman demands answers after losing vision in alleged Israeli military shooting

image.altText: Liam Payne died in October of this year aged 31.

props.synopsis: The singer, who died in October, has been featured on the 40th anniversary remix a week after his funeral.

title.children: Liam Payne's vocals used on controversial 40th anniversary Band Aid Christmas song

image.altText: A poster shows mens faces that are on the FBI most wanted list

props.synopsis: Daniel Andreas San Diego is wanted in the US for bombings in the San Francisco area was arrested and now faces extradition to the America, officials said.

title.children: One of FBI's most wanted fugitives arrested in UK after 20 years on the run

image.altText: Uiatu "Joan" Taufua outside court with sunglasses and a green blouse.

props.synopsis: Joan Taufua is charged with three counts of manslaughter, as well as dangerous driving, drink driving, evading police and driving without a licence.

title.children: Broncos star Payne Haas' mum Joan Taufua committed to stand trial over Gold Coast crash

image.altText: Two men sit next to a man dressed in a gorilla suit.

props.synopsis: Come with us now on a journey through time and space to reflect on The Mighty Boosh's cultural moment now it's been 20 years since the surrealist comedy first aired on TV.

title.children: The Mighty Boosh at 20: How the deranged cult hit captured an entire generation
